description.para: Waits for a thread to exit in a specified time.

param_note.para: The number of milliseconds to wait for thread exit.

tr.td: Function succeeds in waiting for a thread to exit in a specified time.
The thread has not started yet, the state is ThreadState_Unstarted.

remarks.para: The current thread calls this method to wait for the associated thread to exit. The current thread will be put to the waiting list and is woke up after the associated thread terminates or time is out. The current execution thread would wait for the associated thread to exit in specified time. If the associated thread does not exit by the end of the interval because the request to terminate is denied, S_TIMED_OUT is returned to the calling procedure. E_OUTOFMEMORY is returned if something is wrong with the operation of system kernel, which rarely occurs. The largest possible value of a 32-bit integer represents infinity on the operating system. When ms equals INFINITE, the current process will wait until the associated process is finished or till it gets interrupted by another thread.

system.system_name: Windows 2000 or later; Elastos 2.0 or later.
